txt.en:
TBD - Grimbold should now accompany the player as a fighting pet and defeat enemies at the war-camps.

To do: make landmarks for the camps.
Trigger drama to disappear Grimbold.
Defeat enemies at the war-camps at he fords ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Prisoners can be found in Lufût-mos, the Uruk-encampment overlooking the Fords of Isen.\n\nYou should break the chains of the prisoners at the Fords to free them.
Defeated an enemy at a war-camp ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Prisoners can be found in Lufût-mos, the Uruk-encampment overlooking the Fords of Isen.\n\nYou should break the chains of the prisoners at the Fords to free them.

You have defeated a number of hostile White Hand enemies at the Fords of Isen, and destroyed the main tents of the war-camps established on Rohirrim soil.\n\nNow is not the time for the enemy to make its home in Rohan. The war is not yet lost!
Completed
Burn main tents ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Break the prisoners' chains to free them
Break the prisoners' chains to free them ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Burned a main tent ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Freed a group of prisoners ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
A number of prisoners -- brave soldiers from the fords -- can be found in Lufût-mos. You should free these valiant survivors from their chains.
Completed
A number of prisoners -- brave soldiers from the fords -- can be found in Lufût-mos. You should free these valiant survivors from their chains.
You have freed a number of soldiers from their bonds at Lufût-mos. Their outlooks are much brighter, thanks to your heroic intervention.
'Please help us! I don't even want to know what the Uruks have in store....'
'Please help us! I don't even want to know what the Uruks have in store....'
The White Hand has set up two war-camps at the mouth of the Fords, on Rohan's soil. These must be destroyed, for the enemy cannot be allowed to hold any land of the Riddermark.
You have freed a number of soldiers from their bonds at Lufût-mos. Their outlooks are much brighter, thanks to your heroic intervention.
Hostages and Heroes
